he stomach is the place where all the stuff we eat goes to be digested. It secretes a number of juices and enzymes that help in breaking down the food we eat and providing energy in the process. That‚Äôs why an upset stomach is one of the biggest nightmares to all humans, especially those who call themselves ‚Äòfoodies‚Äô.

The stomach contains many things, but what we‚Äôre interested in for the scope of this article is the gastric acid. Also referred to as stomach acid and gastric juice, it‚Äôs basically a digestive fluid ‚Äì comprising hydrochloric acid (around 5,000 ‚Äì 10,000 parts per million), sodium chloride and potassium chloride ‚Äì that forms inside the stomach.

title: How To Cure Kidney Infection
description:
Kidney infection (pyelonephritis) is a type of urinary tract infection (UTI) that generally begins in your urethra or bladder and travels to one or both of your kidneys.

A kidney infection requires prompt medical attention. If not treated properly, a kidney infection can permanently damage your kidneys or the bacteria can spread to your bloodstream and cause a life-threatening infection.

Kidney infection treatment, which usually includes antibiotics, might require hospitalization.

title: How To Cure Low Blood Pressure
description:
Low blood pressure might seem desirable, and for some people, it causes no problems. However, for many people, abnormally low blood pressure (hypotension) can cause dizziness and fainting. In severe cases, low blood pressure can be life-threatening.

A blood pressure reading lower than 90 millimeters of mercury (mm Hg) for the top number (systolic) or 60 mm Hg for the bottom number (diastolic) is generally considered low blood pressure.

The causes of low blood pressure can range from dehydration to serious medical or surgical disorders. It's important to find out what's causing your low blood pressure so that it can be treated.

title: How To Cure Chicken Pox
description:
Chickenpox (varicella) is a viral infection that causes an itchy rash with small, fluid-filled blisters. Chickenpox is highly contagious to people who haven't had the disease or been vaccinated against it. Before routine chickenpox vaccination, virtually all people had been infected by the time they reached adulthood, sometimes with serious complications. Today, the number of cases and hospitalizations is down dramatically.

For most people, chickenpox is a mild disease. Still, it's better to get vaccinated. The chickenpox vaccine is a safe, effective way to prevent chickenpox and its possible complications.

title: pCloud: Free Cloud Storage
description:
With pCloud you can store files from multiple devices to a one beautiful and intuitive cloud storage space. 

Upon joining we will present you with 10 GB FREE cloud storage! 

With pCloud you can:

- expand your phone's storage with up to 2 TB!
- backup all camera photos and videos automatically.
- sync files across all your devices.
- access your files even if you are offline.
- share files, track changes and statistics.
- encrypt your sensitive data with a military-grade client-side encryption - pCloud Crypto¬Æ.
- play music with a built-in audio player.
- upload quickly, regardless of the file size.
 

pCloud is also available for iOS, Windows, MacOS, Linux and any popular web browser. 

Read our Terms of service for full disclosure. 

Learn more about the permissions we use:
https://www.pcloud.com/help/android-help-center/what-permissions-does-the-android-app-require

recentChanges: Bug fixes and optimizations.
comments: The cloud itself is pretty fine, but the app is weak in terms of a cloud app. It can't check file checksum to see if the file already exists so that it doesn't re-upload it. Multi selection of the items are not possible, you should select them manually by hand, which is funny! Recently I've seen some instances of users complaining that pCloud or other 3rd parties scan your files to check if there are any so called "illegal" files and they terminate your account. This is the opposite of privacy!

No way to upload files and open new folders. Yet it reads: "created folder": "uploaded files". Network ok. Other fully functional apps. Update today 22/10/2020. Version2.11.2. But already with the previous version ie version 2.9.1 I had the same problems. But momentary, not like today. Thanks for the attention. Good job . In Trust I always leave 3 stars. GOOD DAY .Review update 22/10/2020 All solved for now. Thanks for the effort, the commitment and the seriousness. Let's go to 4‚≠ê

Looked far and wide, this is the best there is. If you are like me and have bunch of media on your external hdd which makes it very inaccessible to you. Then this is for you, the media streaming facility is excellent. I've compared it's lifetime plan against Google drive, idrive, purchasing a nas. It's without a doubt the most sensible choice.

Still now it's good to use. But one think I want to know,after installing day to now present time, how much MB (products) I upload on this "pCloud" free cloud storage,I found 1 thing is not going well, For ex:- supposed that, I upload 20 MB on this 'pCloud" store,but the problem is I see,everytime I upload any file any size,after completing upload,if I go settings-app & notification-click on this "pCloud" I see as much (MB/GB) upload on "pCloud" storage,this app size will also expend the same.

This company isn't able to repair a bug in the audio player reported 8 months ago. After I sent a reminder I got a reply saying: "Be advised that your feedback has been provided to the Android team months ago. You don't need to worry, we are already working on a new and improved Audio player." - That was in July, no change since then. They claim to be "a young forward-thinking team doing our best to make a significant impact on the rapidly growing IT market". Not like this, guys.

title: Natural Remedies
description:
Natural remedies are safe and useful for common ailments. Most of the health issues are not life threatening and can be treated at home. As an alternative to over the counter medicines, natural remedies can save you some time and money. 

Natural remedies may act slowly and it requires patience. However, they can be very helpful and do not have the collateral effects related to over the counter medicines.

Benefits of Natural Remedies
1.	Composed of all natural based foods such as herbs, fruits, spices and vegetables.

title: Acid Reflux Diet Plan
description:
Acid Reflux Diet & Lifestyle Solution | Is there anyone who has not heard countless commercials to pop a pill to relieve acid reflux? Acid reflux is the flow of stomach acid back into the esophagus. A common symptom is heartburn - a burning discomfort felt anywhere from the stomach up into the chest and throat. Instead of pills, many health experts now recommend an acid reflux diet and other lifestyle solutions. In this app, learn what they are.

That‚Äôs because acid reflux can become a serious, chronic condition called gastroesophageal reflux disease or GERD. GERD can have several unpleasant symptoms that include difficulty swallowing, hoarseness, dry sore throat, and coughing, as well as heartburn. Depending on their severity, these symptoms can significantly impair daily quality of life. Worse yet, GERD can lead to life-threatening conditions, including esophageal ulcers and cancer.

So why not just take the medications that neutralize stomach acid or restrict its production? The problem is, except for the most serious cases of GERD, these drugs are not meant for long-term or continual use. Over time, they can have negative side effects. Antacids can eventually upset the digestive tract and lead to diarrhea or constipation. Proton pump inhibitors like Prevacid and Prilosec, which are used to reduce the production of stomach acid, have been linked to increased risk of osteoporosis (brittle bone disease), pneumonia, and negative drug interactions.

And unfortunately, the many pills now available to treat acid reflux have done little to curtail its incidence. Approximately 40% of adult Americans now suffer from acid reflux. And shockingly, rates of esophageal cancer in the U.S. have increased 500% since the 1970s. Research, particularly a recent study from Denmark following more than 9, 800 GERD sufferers, has linked proton pump inhibitors with increase risk of esophageal cancer.

The first step in reducing GERD is often to limit foods that set off reflux. These ‚Äútrigger foods‚Äù differ from person to person but often include chocolate, coffee, fried foods, peppermint, spicy foods, and carbonated beverages.

Avoid lying down for at least two hours after a meal or after drinking acidic beverages, like soda, or other caffeinated beverages. This can help to prevent stomach contents from flowing back into the esophagus.

The problem is, except for the most serious cases of GERD, these drugs are not meant for long-term or continual use. Over time, they can have negative side effects. Antacids can eventually upset the digestive tract and lead to diarrhea or constipation. Proton pump inhibitors like Prevacid and Prilosec, which are used to reduce the production of stomach acid, have been linked to increased risk of osteoporosis (brittle bone disease), pneumonia, and negative drug interactions.
